wolk package¶

This module provides connection to WolkAbout IoT Platform.

To start publishing data to the platform create an instance of Device class with credentials obtained from the platform and pass it to an instance of WolkConnect class.

For more information about module features visit: https://github.com/Wolkabout/WolkConnect-Python/tree/master/examples/full_feature_set

Connection Management¶

wolk.WolkConnect module¶

WolkConnect Module.

class wolk.WolkConnect.WolkConnect(device, actuation_handler=None, actuator_status_provider=None, configuration_handler=None, configuration_provider=None, outbound_message_queue=None, keep_alive_enabled=True, firmware_handler=None, host=None, port=None, ca_cert=None, outbound_message_factory=None, inbound_message_deserializer=None, connectivity_service=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Exchange data with WolkAbout IoT Platform.

Variables:
  • connectivity_service (wolk.OSMQTTConnectivityService.OSMQTTConnectivityService) – Means of sending/receiving data
  • inbound_message_deserializer (wolk.OSInboundMessageDeserializer.OSInboundMessageDeserializer) – Deserializer of inbound messages
  • device (wolk.Device.Device) – Contains device key and password, and actuator references
  • firmware_update (wolk.OSFirmwareUpdate.OSFirmwareUpdate) – Firmware update handler
  • keep_alive_service (wolk.OSKeepAliveService.OSKeepAliveService) – Keep device connected when not sending data
  • logger (logging.Logger) – Logger instance issued by wolk.LoggerFactory
  • outbound_message_factory (wolk.OSOutboundMessageFactory.OSOutboundMessageFactory) – Create messages to send
  • outbound_message_queue (wolk.interfaces.OutboundMessageQueue.OutboundMessageQueue) – Store data before sending

Provide communication with WolkAbout IoT Platform.

Parameters:
  • device (wolk.Device.Device) – Contains key and password, and actuator references
  • actuation_handler (wolk.interaces.ActuationHandler or None) – Handle actuation commands
  • actuator_status_provider (wolk.interfaces.ActuatorStatusProvider or None) – Read actuator status
  • outbound_message_queue (wolk.interfaces.OutboundMessageQueue.OutboundMessageQueue or None) – Store messages before sending
  • keep_alive_enabled (bool) – Enable or disable the keep alive service
  • firmware_handler (wolk.FileSystemFirmwareHandler.FileSystemFirmwareHandler or None) – Firmware update support
  • host (str or None) – Host name or IP address of the remote broker
  • port (int or None) – Network port of the server host to connect to
  • ca_cert (str or None) – String path to Certificate Authority certificate file
  • outbound_message_factory (wolk.interfaces.OutboundMessageFactory or None) – Creator of messages to be sent
  • inbound_message_deserializer (wolk.interfaces.InboundMessageDeserializer or None) – Deserializer of messages from the Platform
  • connectivity_service (wolk.interfaces.ConnectivityService or None) – Provider of connection to Platform

Publish an alarm to WolkAbout IoT Platform.

Parameters:
  • reference (str) – Reference of the alarm
  • active (bool) – Current state of the alarm
  • timestamp (int or None) – Unix timestamp. If not provided, platform will assign

Parameters:

  • value (int or float or str) – The value of the sensor reading
  • timestamp (int or None) – Unix timestamp. If not provided, platform will assign

Connect the device to the WolkAbout IoT Platform.

wolk.Device module¶

Hold all necessary information to communicate with WolkAbout IoT Platform.

ivar actuator_references:
 Actuator references enabled on device
vartype actuator_references:
 list
ivar key:Device key obtained when creating device on WolkAbout IoT Platform
vartype key:str
ivar logger:Logger instance issued by wolk.LoggerFactory
vartype logger:logging.Logger
ivar password:Password obtained when creating device on WolkAbout IoT Platform
vartype password:
 str

wolk.OSKeepAliveService module¶

OS Keep Alive Service module.

class wolk.OSKeepAliveService.OSKeepAliveService(connectivity_service, outbound_message_factory, interval=600)[source]¶

Bases: wolk.interfaces.KeepAliveService.KeepAliveService

Send messages to platform in regular intervals to keep device connected.

Used for cases where no data is being sent by device for over 30 minutes.

Variables:
  • connectivity_service (wolk.wolkcore.ConnectivityService.ConnectivityService) – Connectivity service used to publish
  • interval (int) – Number of seconds between each keep alive message
  • logger (logging.Logger) – Logger instance issued by wolk.LoggerFactory
  • outbound_message_factory (wolk.wolkcore.OutboundMessageFactory.OutboundMessageFactory) – message factory used to create pings
  • timer (wolk.OSKeepAliveService.RepeatingTimer) – timer for sending ping messages

Service for sending keep alive messages.

Parameters:
  • connectivity_service (wolk.wolkcore.ConnectivityService.ConnectivityService) – Connectivity service used to publish
  • outbound_message_factory (wolk.wolkcore.OutboundMessageFactory.OutboundMessageFactory) – Message factory used to create pings
  • interval (int or None) – Number of seconds between each keep alive message
handle_pong()[source]¶

Handle keep alive response message received from the platform.

send_keep_alive()[source]¶

Make ping and send.

Create a keep alive message from the outbound message factory and publishes it using the connectivity service

start()[source]¶

Send a keep alive message as soon as the device is connected.

Starts a repeating timer to send subsequent keep alive messages every self.interval seconds

stop()[source]¶

Stop the repeating timer.

class wolk.OSKeepAliveService.RepeatingTimer(interval, f, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

Repeating timer calls function with arguments every interval.

  • f (function) – function to call
  • interval (int) – number of seconds after which to call function
  • kwargs (kwargs) – keyword arguments
  • timer (threading.Timer) – timer

Create a repeating timer.

Parameters:
  • interval (int) – number of seconds after which to call function
  • f (function) – function to call
  • *args (list) – list of arguments
  • **kwargs (kwargs) – keyword arguments

Call function and start timer.

cancel()[source]¶

Cancel timer.

Start timer.

wolk.FileSystemFirmwareHandler module¶

FileSystemFirmwareHandler Module.

class wolk.FileSystemFirmwareHandler.FileSystemFirmwareHandler(version, chunk_size, max_file_size, firmware_installer, download_location, firmware_url_download_handler=None)[source]¶

Bases: wolk.interfaces.FirmwareHandler.FirmwareHandler

Firmware handler that uses OS provided disk storage for firmware files.

Variables:
  • chunk_size (int) – Desired chunk size in bytes
  • download_location (str) – Where to store the completed firmware file
  • file_name (str) – Name of firmware file
  • file_size (int) – Size of firmware file in bytes
  • file_url (str) – URL where there firmware file is located
  • firmware_installer (wolk.FirmwareInstaller.FirmwareInstaller) – Installer of firmware file
  • firmware_url_download_handler (wolk.FirmwareURLDownloadHandler.FirmwareURLDownloadHandler or None) – URL downloader
  • logger (logging.Logger) – Logger instance issued by wolk.LoggerFactory
  • max_file_size (int) – Maximum file size supported by device in bytes
  • report_result_callback (function) – Callback for reporting URL download result
  • temp_file (file object) – Handle of temp file used to store incomplete firmware file
  • version (str) – Current version of the device firmware
  • version_persister (persistent_queue.PersistentQueue) – Means of storing current version on disk

Handle file manipulation on disk storage.

Parameters:
  • version (str) – Current version of the device firmware
  • chunk_size (int) – Desired chunk size in bytes
  • max_file_size (int) – Maximum file size supported by device in bytes
  • firmware_installer (wolk.FirmwareInstaller.FirmwareInstaller) – Installer of firmware file
  • download_location (str) – Where to store the completed firmware file
  • firmware_url_download_handler (wolk.FirmwareURLDownloadHandler.FirmwareURLDownloadHandler or None) – Optional URL downloader

wolk.LoggerFactory module¶

LoggerFactory Module.

Bases: object

Factory for issuing ready to use loggers in other modules.

Create a factory that will give loggers through calls to get_logger().

Parameters:
  • level (int, optional) – Set the desired logging level
  • log_format (str, optional) – Desired logging format
  • console (bool, optional) – Should the log messages be outputted to the console

wolk.OSFirmwareUpdate module¶

OSFirmwareUpdate Module.

class wolk.OSFirmwareUpdate.OSFirmwareUpdate(firmware_handler=None)[source]¶

Bases: wolk.interfaces.FirmwareUpdate.FirmwareUpdate

Responsible for everything related to the firmware update process.

Variables:
  • auto_install (bool) – install upon receiving the firmware file
  • expected_number_of_chunks (int) – expected number of firmware chunks
  • file_hash (str) – hash of firmware file received from the platform
  • file_name (str) – firmware file name
  • file_size (int) – firmware file size
  • firmware_handler (wolk.wolkcore.FirmwareHandler.FirmwareHandler) – implementation of FirmwareHandler interface
  • install_timer (threading.Timer) – timer for install countdown
  • last_packet_hash (str) – hash of last valid packet received
  • logger (logging.Logger) – Logger instance issued by wolk.LoggerFactory
  • max_retries (int) – number of retries for a firmware packet
  • minimum_packet_size (int) – minimal size of a firmware chunk
  • next_chunk_index (int) – index of next firmware chunk
  • on_file_packet_request_callback (function) – callback for chunk request
  • on_status_callback (function) – callback for reporting firmware update status
  • request_timeout (threading.Timer) – countdown timer for request timeout
  • retry_count (int) – current retry count
  • state (wolk.wolkcore.FirmwareUpdateStateType) – current firmware installation state

Responsible for firmware update flow.

Parameters:firmware_handler (wolk.wolkcore.FirmwareHandler.FirmwareHandler or None) – Responsible for the firmware file itself

validate_firmware_file()[source]¶

Validate the completed firmware file.

Compares the sha256 hash of the received file with the file hash received from the platform.

Returns:valid
Return type:bool
validate_packet(packet)[source]¶

Validate received firmware file packet.

Checks if the packed is bigger than the minimum packet size and checks if the sha256 hash of the data matches the hash received from the platform

Parameters:packet (wolk.wolkcore.FileTransferPacket.FileTransferPacket) – Packet to validate
Returns:valid
Return type:bool

wolk.OSMQTTConnectivityService module¶

OSMQTTConnectivityService Module.

class wolk.OSMQTTConnectivityService.OSMQTTConnectivityService(device, qos=2, host='api-demo.wolkabout.com', port=8883, ca_cert=None)[source]¶

Bases: wolk.interfaces.ConnectivityService.ConnectivityService

Handle sending and receiving MQTT messages.

Variables:
  • ca_cert (str) – Path to ca.crt file used for TLS
  • client (paho.mqtt.Client) – MQTT client used to send/receive data
  • connected (bool) – State of the connection
  • connected_rc (int) – return code of the connection
  • device (wolk.Device.Device) – Holds authentication information and actuator references
  • host (str) – Address of the MQTT broker
  • inbound_message_listener (function) – Callback function for inbound messages
  • logger (logging.Logger) – Logger instance issued by wolk.LoggerFactory
  • port (int) – Port to which to send messages
  • qos (int) – Quality of Service for the MQTT connection
  • topics (list) – List of topics to subscribe to

Provide the connection to the WolkAbout IoT Platform.

Parameters:
  • device (wolk.Device.Device) – Contains device key, password and actuator references
  • qos (int or None) – Quality of Service for MQTT connection
  • host (str or None) – Address of the MQTT broker
  • port (int or None) – Port to which to send messages
  • ca_cert (str or None) – Certificate file used to encrypt the connection
connect()[source]¶

Establish the connection to the WolkAbout IoT platform.

If there are actuators it will subscribe to topics that will contain actuator commands. Subscribes to firmware update related topics. Starts a loop to handle inbound messages.

Raises:RuntimeError – Reason for connection being refused
disconnect()[source]¶

Disconnects the device from the WolkAbout IoT Platform.

on_mqtt_connect(client, userdata, flags, rc)[source]¶

Handle when the client receives a CONNACK response from the server.

Parameters:
  • client (paho.mqtt.Client) – Client that received the message
  • userdata (str) – private user data set in Client()
  • flags (int) – Response flags sent by the broker
  • rc (int) – Connection result
on_mqtt_disconnect(client, userdata, rc)[source]¶

Handle when the client disconnects from the broker.

Parameters:
  • client (paho.mqtt.Client) – Client that received the message
  • userdata (str) – private user data set in Client()
  • rc (int) – Disconnection result
Raises:

RuntimeError – Unexpected disconnection

Serialize inbound messages and pass them to inbound message listener.

Parameters:
  • client (paho.mqtt.Client) – Client that received the message
  • userdata (str) – Private user data set in Client()
  • message (paho.mqtt.MQTTMessage) – Class with members: topic, payload, qos, retain.

Combines sensor reading messages of the same reference into a single message.
